intro: Acmispon micranthus, commonly known as mountain blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has trifoliate leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Acmispon micranthus is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and its drought tolerance.
